title: MERGE Operations in deltaR
text: Delta Lake’s MERGE operation allows perform sophisticated upserts, combining insert, update, delete operations single atomic transaction. particularly useful : Upserts: Update existing records insert new ones Change Data Capture (CDC): Applying incremental changes table Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD): Managing historical data data warehouses Data synchronization: Keeping tables sync source systems vignette demonstrates use delta_merge() function associated clause builders deltaR.

title: MERGE Operations in deltaR
text: merge operation follows builder pattern: Start delta_merge() specify target table, source data, join predicate Add one clauses (when_matched_*, when_not_matched_*) Execute merge_execute()
code: library(deltaR)

title: MERGE Operations in deltaR
text: Update existing records match found:
code: # Create target table target <- data.frame(   id = 1:3,   name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie"),   score = c(100, 85, 90) ) write_deltalake(target, "path/to/table")  # Source data with updated scores source <- data.frame(   id = c(1, 2),   name = c("Alice", "Bob"),   score = c(105, 88) )  # Update matched rows result <- delta_merge("path/to/table", source, "target.id = source.id") |>   when_matched_update(c(score = "source.score")) |>   merge_execute()  # Result metrics print(result) # $num_target_rows_updated # [1] 2

title: MERGE Operations in deltaR
text: Insert new records match found target:
code: # Source with new records source <- data.frame(   id = c(4, 5),   name = c("Diana", "Eve"),   score = c(92, 78) )  # Insert non-matching rows result <- delta_merge("path/to/table", source, "target.id = source.id") |>   when_not_matched_insert(c(     id = "source.id",     name = "source.name",     score = "source.score"   )) |>   merge_execute()  print(result$num_target_rows_inserted) # [1] 2

code: source <- data.frame(   id = c(1, 6),       # 1 exists, 6 is new   name = c("Alice Updated", "Frank"),   score = c(110, 82) )  result <- delta_merge("path/to/table", source, "target.id = source.id") |>   when_matched_update(c(     name = "source.name",     score = "source.score"   )) |>   when_not_matched_insert(c(     id = "source.id",     name = "source.name",     score = "source.score"   )) |>   merge_execute()  print(result) # $num_target_rows_updated # [1] 1 # $num_target_rows_inserted # [1] 1

text: data Data write. Can data.frame, Arrow Table, Arrow RecordBatch, object can converted Arrow RecordBatchReader via nanoarrow::as_nanoarrow_array_stream(). table_or_uri Character. Path Delta table (local filesystem cloud storage URI). mode Character. handle existing data. One : "error" (default): Fail table exists. "append": Add new data table. "overwrite": Replace data table. "ignore": nothing table exists. partition_by Character vector. Column names partition (optional). name Character. Table name metadata (optional, used creating new table). description Character. Table description metadata (optional). storage_options Named list. Storage backend options credentials (optional). schema_mode Character. handle schema evolution (optional). One : "overwrite": Replace schema new schema. "merge": Merge new schema existing schema. target_file_size Integer. Target size bytes output file (optional). set, writer try create files approximately size.
